content:
3.66. 
Moment of divorce 
1. The marriage shall be deemed to be dissolved as from the date of the entry into force of the court's decision to dissolve the marriage or as from the date of the entry into force of the agreement on the consequences of the dissolution of the marriage certified by a notary. 
2. The court must send the decision by electronic means to the civil registry office which registered the marriage no later than the working day following the date on which the court's decision to dissolve the marriage becomes final. 
3. The notary who has approved the agreement on the consequences of the dissolution of the marriage shall, not later than on the next working day following the date of entry into force of the agreement, transmit by electronic means a notification of the approved agreement on the consequences of the dissolution of the marriage to the civil registry office which registered the marriage and to the register of marriage contracts. If the agreement on the consequences of the dissolution of the marriage approved by the notary changes the legal status of the registered object or substantially alters the conditions for its possession, use and disposal, the notary shall, in accordance with the time limits laid down in this paragraph, transmit the notification of the approved agreement on the consequences of the dissolution of the marriage to the keeper of the register in which the object or the rights in rem over it have been registered.
